1775899 THE JALLIANWALA BAGH NATIONAL MEMORIAL ACT, 1951
ACT NO. 25 OF 1951 [ 1st May, 1951.]
An Act to provide for the erection and management of a National Memorial to perpetuate the memory of those killed or wounded on the 13th day of April, 1919, in Jallianwala Bagh.
BE it enacted by Parliament as follows:-
1716986 1Short title. This Act may be called the Jallianwala Bagh National Memorial Act, 1951.
824958 2 Definitions. In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires,-
1781737 a" Memorial" means the Jallianwala Bagh National Memorial to perpetuate the memory of those killed or wounded on the 13th day of April, 1919, on the site known as the Jallianwala Bagh, Amritsar;
892103 b" Trust" means the Trust for the erection and management of the Memorial;
1957677 c" Trustees" means the Trustees of the Jallianwala Bagh National Memorial.
342980 3 Objects of the Trust. The objects of the Trust shall be-
1941928 ato erect and maintain suitable buildings, structures and parks at or near the site of the Jallianwala Bagh in the city of Amritsar, to perpetuate the memory of those who were killed or wounded on the 13th day of April, 1919, on the said site;
513033 bto acquire lands, buildings and other properties for the purposes of the Trust; and
868281 cto raise and receive funds for the purposes of the Memorial.
1464727 4
1107881 1Trustees of the Jallianwala Bagh National Memorial. The Trustees of the Jallianwala Bagh National Memorial shall be the following, namely:-
132262 aShri Jawaharlal Nehru, (b) Dr. Saifuddin Kitchlew, 22
645083 cMaulana Abul Kalam Azad,
156475 dthe President of the Indian National Congress,
914964 ethe Governor of the State of Punjab,
1960085 fthe Chief Minister of the State of Punjab, and
883756 gthree persons nominated by the Central Government.
1883803 2The Trustees shall be a body corporate with perpetual succession by the name of the" Trustees of the Jallianwala Bagh National Memorial" and a common seal, and in that name shall sue and be sued, and shall have power to acquire and hold property, to enter into contracts and to do all acts necessary for and consistent with, the purposes of this Act.
277963 5 Term of office of Trustees.
1520063 1The three Trustees mentioned in clauses (a), (b) and (c) of sub- section (1) of section 4 shall be Trustees for life.
427622 2Every Trustee nominated under clause (g) of the said sub- section shall be a Trustee for a period of five years, and shall be eligible for renomination.
40608 6Property vested in Trustees. All the property and funds set out in the Schedule to this Act and all other property, whether movable or immovable, which may hereafter be given, bequeathed or otherwise transferred for this purposes of the Memorial or acquired for the said purposes shall vest in the Trustees.
1681669 7 Power of Trustees to appoint committee of management.
1466223 1 For the purposes of managing the affairs of the Trust, the Trustees may, by resolution passed at a meeting, appoint a committee of management, and entrust to it such powers, duties and functions, under such directions and limitations, as may be defined by such resolution.
1376953 2The Trustees may appoint any persons as members of the committee of management, whether such persons are Trustees or not, and may, from time to time, vary or rescind any resolution passed by it under this section.
1039568 8Validity of acts of Trustees not to be questioned by reason of vacancy, etc. No act of the Trustees shall be deemed to be invalid merely by reason of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the body of Trustees.
135931 9 Power to make rules.
1443520 1The Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, make rules 1 to carry out the objects of this Act.
23 1For the Jallianwala Bagh National Memorial Rules, 1952, see Gazette of India, 1952, Pt. II, Sec. 3, p. 1484.
1185124 2In particular, and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide for-
1824787 athe manner in which funds belonging to the Memorial shall be kept, deposited or invested;
991294 bthe mode of authentication of orders for payment of money by the Trustees;
970206 cthe form in which accounts shall be kept by the Trustees and the audit and publication of such accounts;
672590 dthe laying out, erection, improvement, maintenance and management of the Memorial and the care and custody of the properties thereof;
373499 ethe conditions under which the public shall have access to the Memorial or particular parts thereof and the regula- tion of the conduct of persons entering the precincts of the Memorial;
1736423 fthe preservation of, and the prevention of injury to or interference with, any property vested in the Trustees and the prevention of persons from trespassing into any parti- cular part of the Memorial.
1779986 3A rule made under this section may provide that a breach of any rule made under clauses (e) and (f) of sub- section (2) shall be punishable with fine which may extend to one hundred rupees.
206106 10 Power of Trustees to make regulations. The Trustees may make regulations consistent with this Act for all or any of the following purposes, namely:-
1545893 athe manner in which meetings of the Trustees shall be convened, the quorum for the transaction of any business thereat and the procedure at such meetings;
481733 bthe manner in which a majority decision of the Trustees shall be obtained by circulation to the Trustees of the matter requiring decision;
784067 cthe term of office of members of the committee of management, their powers and duties, and the circumstances in which and the conditions subject to which such powers and duties may be exercised;
731062 dthe appointment of such officers and servants as may be necessary for the purposes of the Trust, and their terms and conditions of service.
